Comments_List: I learned how to manage an independent research project of substantial length.
It's a chance to get do an in-depth study of something you find interesting in philosophy.

More structure  mandated meetings with advisors, official deadlines for drafts, etc.  might be helpful. Although I welcomed the opportunity to design my own research and meet my own deadlines, I could have benefited from a bit more external guidance at times.
Do it if you actually want to learn how to do your own research; don't do it if you won't take it seriously.
Absolutely. One of the most rewarding experiences at Yale.
